criteria: Accuracy in identifying caution and danger labels on products.
Application of knowledge to real-life scenarios
descriptions: Does not identify any caution or danger labels.
Identifies only one or two caution or danger labels with significant inaccuracies.
Identifies some caution and danger labels but misses key information or confuses symbols.
Identifies most common caution and danger labels with minor errors or omissions.
Accurately identifies nearly all caution and danger labels, demonstrating a strong understanding.
Consistently and accurately identifies all caution and danger labels, explaining their meaning and potential consequences.
Attempts to explain label meaning but explanations are incorrect.
Can explain the meaning of a couple of labels, but most are still unknown
Can explain the meaning of most labels
Understands the meaning and intention of labels and how that would relate to safety
Explains the full meaning of all labels, including subtle differences and how it relates to the danger it presents.
Cannot relate label information to real-life situations or safety practices.
Struggles to apply label information to real-life situations, providing vague or incorrect examples.
Identifies basic applications of label information but lacks detail or practical understanding.
Applies label information to common real-life scenarios with reasonable accuracy and some detail.
Demonstrates a strong ability to apply label information to a variety of real-life scenarios, offering practical safety advice.
Expertly applies label information to complex or novel real-life scenarios, providing comprehensive safety strategies and demonstrating critical thinking.
